trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the collection of indexes of checked items (including items in an indeterminate state) in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref>.
The checked indexes collection is a subset of the indexes into the collection of all items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox> control.
These indexes specify items in a checked or indeterminate state.
The following table is an example of the indexed collection of items in the control (all items contained in the control).
Index
Item
Check State
object 1
object 2
object 3
object 4
object 5
Based on the previous example, the following table shows the indexed collection of indexes of checked items.
Index
Index of Item

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox> class has two members that allow you to access the stored indexes, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection.Item%2A> property and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
Based on the previous example, a call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection.Item%2A> property with a parameter value of 1 returns a value of 3.
A call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> with a parameter of 3 returns a value of 1.
Determines whether the specified index is located in the collection.

You can use this method to determine whether an index from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.Items%2A> collection is in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndices%2A> collection.
The index to locate in the collection.
`true` if the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.ObjectCollection"></xref> is an item in this collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.
You can use this method to combine the selected indexes from multiple collections into a single array.
The destination array.
The zero-based relative index in dest at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
array is multidimensional.
index is less than zero.
The number of elements in the source <xref href="System.Array"></xref> is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
The type of the source <xref href="System.Array"></xref> cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
Gets the number of checked items.
The number of indexes in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndices"></xref> collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for navigating through the list.
Returns an index into the collection of checked indexes.
The `index` parameter is the index of a checked item in the items collection.
The return value is the corresponding index into the checked indexes collection.
The index of the checked item.
The index that specifies the index of the checked item or -1 if the index parameter is not in the checked indexes collection.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref> class overview.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
`true` in all cases.
Gets the index of a checked item in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref> control.
The `index` parameter is an index into the checked indexes collection.
The return value is the corresponding indexed value, which is the index of the checked item in the items collection.
An index into the checked indexes collection.
This index specifies the index of the checked item you want to retrieve.
The index of the checked item.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref> class overview.
The index is less than zero.
-or-
The index is not in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe).
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> used to synchronize to the collection.
Adds an item to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.

To add an item to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemChecked%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemCheckState%2A> method.
The object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Removes all items from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Clear"></xref>.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.

To clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemChecked%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemCheckState%2A> method.
Always thrown.
Determines whether the specified index is located within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Contains(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The index to locate in the collection.

`true` if the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.ObjectCollection"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref> is an item in this collection; otherwise, `false`.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IndexOf(System.Object)"></xref>.
The zero-based index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.ObjectCollection"></xref> to locate in this collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref> instance is cast to an <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.

To add an item to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemChecked%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemCheckState%2A> method.
The index at which value should be inserted.
The object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`true` in all cases.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Item(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the item to get.
The index value from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.ObjectCollection"></xref> that is stored at the specified location.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.

To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemChecked%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemCheckState%2A> method.
The object to be removed from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
or a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.RemoveAt(System.Int32)"></xref>.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.

To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemChecked%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.SetItemCheckState%2A> method.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
Always thrown.
